ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: More facility with the language and concepts of auctions. Interesting applications with a focus on current research.
I learnt a lot of different applications of graphs and networks.
I learned how to think critically about networks research
We learned a fair amount about a specific topic (mechanism design).
Reading and understanding original, technical economics/mathematics papers

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strength: a relaxed course for seniors Weakness: I don't think that students should teach one lecture together (or, if they do, make sure the first student doesn't go over on their time!)
It was good. I just wish students went more in depth in their lectures.
Self directed - you get out what you put in
You get as much out of this course as you put into it.

It is very productive to work to understand original papers and present on them, though I don't feel students gain much from each other's presentations. More should be done to involve the class with other students' presentations (psets, summaries, questions, etc).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: A nice respite at the end of the econ/math major. The mechanism design section with Dirk was great, though I can't speak of the networks section with Ron.
It's required for Math and Math/Econ.
it's mad chill with dirk yo
Take this class with Coifman for Econmath. Super chill and you may learn something.
If you need a lighter work load, take it
This class entirely depends on the instructor and the topic. I took the Econ (mechanism design) section with Bergemann and loved it.
The course is great, and you'll know if you have to take it.
Not particularly. While it is certainly stimulating to put together your own presentation, the rest of the course (hearing other student presentations) didn't feel particularly productive.
